commit_message:
libvirt: Add NUMA cell count to cpu_info

Adds the number of NUMA cells from libvirt to the cpu_info['topology']
attribute, so that clients using that data for socket/core/thread
counting on hypervisors can get better-quality results.

Closes-Bug: 1156456
Change-Id: I945f32bce96f27939d39b86af6ccec73b754f886
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/223869/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cpu.cells = 1 "topology": {"cells": 1, "cores": 2, "threads": 1, "sockets": 4}}

commit_message:
Combine exit codes of the two functional test runs

The script was only returning the exit code of the second of the
two test runs.  With this change, a failure of either either run
will correctly be reported as an error.

Change-Id: I81766dee2ac141ceddf683b50a2aef11a79f968b
Closes-bug: #1488693

commit_message:
[COVERAGE] Turn off coverage

We need to fix .coveragerc and turn off coverage in one patch, since
cover.sh scrip launch check for previous patch which contain uncompatible
with coverage 4.0 option.

Also, fix for floating bug is required.

Change-Id: I4cc49c01bc5bb633f08353762f963cb4343fc6cb
Partial-Bug: #1497897

commit_message:
Cleanup some bash comparisions

Use "=" instead of "==" for normal tests to conform with POSIX,
use -z in cases it's comparison against "". Replace [[]] where
not needed with [].

Change-Id: Id40a560e3cf2faf8a14a1533c3a31f145796fd67

subject: Fix race between resource audit and cpu pinning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-26 13:25:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/df07811c5d97124d271e1b1741ca9ac0b7b5dd6b', 'message': "Fix race between resource audit and cpu pinning

This fixes a race between the claimed CPUs of an instance being
persisted to the DB, and the resource audit scanning the DB for
instances and subtracting pinned CPUs from the list of available CPUs.

The problem only shows up when the following sequence happens:
1) instance A (with dedicated cpus) boots on a compute node
2) resource audit runs on that compute node
3) instance B (with dedicated cpus) boots on the same compute node

The bug is that the claimed numa topology isn't updated until
after we release COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE, so when the resource
audit retrieves the list of instances the numa_topology hasn't
been updated yet for the most recent one.

The fix is to persist the claimed numa topology before releasing
COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE.

Closes-Bug: #1454451
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2427d288bc017a5b91430ffe16419d47703d2060)

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py

Change-Id: I553f2e43a68577c83d890c3671380af68f9e725a
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-12 12:12:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b13726bcf6b9e6a006ec9bfcde051331741ded5a', 'message': "Fix race between resource audit and cpu pinning

This fixes a race between the claimed CPUs of an instance being
persisted to the DB, and the resource audit scanning the DB for
instances and subtracting pinned CPUs from the list of available CPUs.

The problem only shows up when the following sequence happens:
1) instance A (with dedicated cpus) boots on a compute node
2) resource audit runs on that compute node
3) instance B (with dedicated cpus) boots on the same compute node

The bug is that the claimed numa topology isn't updated until
after we release COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE, so when the resource
audit retrieves the list of instances the numa_topology hasn't
been updated yet for the most recent one.

The fix is to persist the claimed numa topology before releasing
COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE.

Closes-Bug: #1454451

(cherry picked from commit 2427d288bc017a5b91430ffe16419d47703d2060)

	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

commit_message:
Fix race between resource audit and cpu pinning

This fixes a race between the claimed CPUs of an instance being
persisted to the DB, and the resource audit scanning the DB for
instances and subtracting pinned CPUs from the list of available CPUs.

The problem only shows up when the following sequence happens:
1) instance A (with dedicated cpus) boots on a compute node
2) resource audit runs on that compute node
3) instance B (with dedicated cpus) boots on the same compute node

The bug is that the claimed numa topology isn't updated until
after we release COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE, so when the resource
audit retrieves the list of instances the numa_topology hasn't
been updated yet for the most recent one.

The fix is to persist the claimed numa topology before releasing
COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE.

Closes-Bug: #1454451
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2427d288bc017a5b91430ffe16419d47703d2060)

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py

Change-Id: I553f2e43a68577c83d890c3671380af68f9e725a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/185591/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # self._set_instance_host_and_node() will save instance_ref to the DB # so set instance_ref['numa_topology'] first. We need to make sure # that numa_topology is saved while under COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE # so that the resource audit knows about any cpus we've pinned. self._set_instance_host_and_node(context, instance_ref) def _set_instance_host_and_node(self, context, instance): instance.host = self.host instance.launched_on = self.host instance.node = self.nodename instance.save()
deleted_lines: self._set_instance_host_and_node(context, instance_ref) def _set_instance_host_and_node(self, context, instance_ref): values = {'host': self.host, 'node': self.nodename, 'launched_on': self.host} self.conductor_api.instance_update(context, instance_ref['uuid'], **values) instance_ref['host'] = self.host instance_ref['launched_on'] = self.host instance_ref['node'] = self.nodename

commit_message:
api: add default_floating_pool parameter

default_floating_pool is an parameter used by nova api to talk to
neutron server and associate floating IP to servers from the public
network. Upstream default is 'nova', let's keep it but at least this
patch allows to change the parameter.

Change-Id: Ic060fc18c8f5d7dc8fcf1d7bd921623dc505a515
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/99/223899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*default_floating_pool*] # (optional) Default pool for floating IPs # Defaults to 'nova' # $default_floating_pool = 'nova', 'DEFAULT/default_floating_pool': value => $default_floating_pool;

commit_message:
Make sure cinder is created before creating Cinder::Type

When creating Cinder::Type resources, we need to make sure Keystone
resources for Cinder are created, because they'll be used by
Cinder::Type to create a volume type.

This patch is useful when Cinder::Type is declared on the same node as
Cinder API & Keystone server.

Change-Id: Ia823d80a4eb384ac51d8b1711e8664a3d29247f7

condense down to translation-jobs.

commit_message:
Revert "Remove Cisco-specific neutron client commands"

This reverts commit 8292cb85f8830e65284736ea1f9bae2f344c084a.

This cannot go in 3.x since it requires a version bump.
Will repropose for Mitaka (4.x client).

Change-Id: Ia89d3e3c9c4a27ffbe3089354b4eaeca527de8ae

commit_message:
Add missing X-xxxx HTTP headers to the unauth context

The unauth context is used by Barbican out of the box for local API evaluation
as well as for deployments where an authenticating proxy (such as Repose) is
placed in front of Barbican. Hence this unauth context must provide all the
required HTTP header settings to the Barbican context prior to policy engine
computation for RBAC and so forth. This CR provides those missing headers.

Change-Id: Ib1d6abdb384f5883aa06ec1b6811c3ad80291568
Closes-Bug: #1497639

commit_message:
Use of ast for integers doesn't changes type

ast.literal_eval doesn't change types for Integer
Booleans resulting in DBAPIError exceptions with
at least postgresql. Boolean columns need to be
explicitly cast to boolean types.

Change-Id: If10be4f6748be3cad48167ba6bbf4433ce9c8abf
Closes-Bug: #1494475
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/58/225558/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adding validation of workflow graph

 * To avoid circular dependency between mistral.workbook.parser
 and mistral.workflow.commands reserved task names were moved to
 workbook.tasks module.

Closes-Bug: #1494635

Change-Id: I21337a9b616f55c3bbdc957538b25d36246b3903

commit_message:
Modify nova help list message for --tenant

The --all-tenants option does not have impact
when --tenant is used. Help message about
--all-tenants inside the help section of --tenant
creates uncertainty.

Change-Id: Iaddf2370f349c6da712e0096a6ecbcbc61d37836
Closes-Bug: #1497151

The previous code was initializing the keystone client each

commit_message:
Modifed http_check to init keystone clients and re-use

The previous code was initializing the keystone client each
time check was called in the case use_keystone is True.
Our default http_check config uses drop wizard checks that do
not require keystone.  This could eliminate the number of
keystone token requests for any http_checks that require
a keystone token, since now they will be cached.

Change-Id: I47827d549365c29a36846d51ede0fb06da435ac7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/90/224190/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: super(HTTPCheck, self).__init__(name, init_config, agent_config, instances) # init the keystone client if instance has use_keystone self._api_config = cfg.Config().get_config('Api') self._ksclients = {} for instance in instances: addr, username, password, timeout, headers, response_time, \ disable_ssl_validation, use_keystone, keystone_config, \ instance_name = self._load_http_conf(instance) if use_keystone: # keystone is a singleton. It will be initialized once, # the first config instance used. if keystone_config: ksclient = keystone.Keystone(keystone_config) else: ksclient = keystone.Keystone(self._api_config) self._ksclients[instance_name] = ksclient instance_name = instance.get('name', None) if instance_name is None: raise Exception("Bad configuration. You must specify a name") return url, username, password, timeout, headers, response_time, \ ssl, use_keystone, keystone_config, instance_name addr, username, password, timeout, headers, response_time, \ disable_ssl_validation, use_keystone, keystone_config, \ instance_name = self._load_http_conf(instance) ksclient = self._ksclients[instance_name] token = ksclient.get_token() ksclient.refresh_token()
deleted_lines: super(HTTPCheck, self).__init__(name, init_config, agent_config, instances) return url, username, password, timeout, headers, response_time, ssl, use_keystone, keystone_config addr, username, password, timeout, headers, response_time, disable_ssl_validation, use_keystone, keystone_config = self._load_http_conf( instance) config = cfg.Config() api_config = config.get_config('Api') if keystone_config: key = keystone.Keystone(keystone_config) else: key = keystone.Keystone(api_config) token = key.get_token() key.refresh_token()

registerSuite(function() { var common, modal, clusterPage; return { name: 'Simple Pages', setup: function() { common = new Common(this.remote); modal = new ModalWindow(this.remote); clusterPage = new ClusterPage(this.remote); return this.remote .then(function() { return common.getIn(); }) }, 'Notification Page': function() { return this.remote // Check that the badge notification indicator is visible .findByCssSelector('.notifications-icon .badge') .then(function(badgeNotification) { badgeNotification.isDisplayed().then(function(isDisplayed) { assert.ok(isDisplayed, 'badge notification indicator is shown in navigation'); }) }) .end() // Go to Notification page .clickByCssSelector('.notifications-icon') .clickLinkByText('View all') // Notification page is rendered .waitForCssSelector('.notifications-page', 2000) // There are one or more notifications on the page .findByCssSelector('.notifications-page .row.notification') .end() .findByCssSelector('.notifications-icon .badge') .then(function(badgeNotification) { badgeNotification.isDisplayed().then(function(isDisplayed) { assert.isFalse(isDisplayed, 'badge notification indicator is shown in navigation'); }) .then(function() { return common.addNodesToCluster(1, ['Storage - Cinder']); }) // Just in case - reset and hide badge notification counter by clicking on it .clickByCssSelector('.notifications-icon') .then(function() { return common.removeCluster(clusterName); }) .findByCssSelector('.notifications-icon .badge') .then(function(badgeNotification) { badgeNotification.isDisplayed().then(function(isDisplayed) { assert.ok(isDisplayed, 'badge notification indicator is shown in navigation'); }) }) .end() .clickByCssSelector('.notifications-icon') .waitForCssSelector('.notifications-popover .notification.clickable', 15000) // Check if Node Information dialog is shown .clickByCssSelector('.notifications-popover .notification.clickable p') .then(function() { return modal.waitToOpen(); }) .then(function() { // Dialog with node information is open return modal.checkTitle('Node Information'); }) } }; }); });

commit_message:
Cleanup a few auth_token comments

It is not only memcached cases where revocations need to be checked,
so this cleans up an old comment that was no longer giving the full
picture on that. It also corrects a couple other nit grammatical
issues for better clarity.

Change-Id: I51e51d2127c79b11b206e1459f3e83957bf44128

commit_message:
Remove non-Zanata propose jobs

Now that we have switched all projects to pulling translations from
Zanata, as a first step, destroy all the jobs and their related job
groups that are no longer used.

Change-Id: I616dba7a8e81dfefeaa246ec5a80c1fdb47a2208

commit_message:
Add password for user cirros in the guide of launch an instance

The guide of launch an instance only mentioned the user name of image
cirros which is 'cirros' and didn`t provide the password of the user
'cirros'.
This commit intend to add password for user 'cirros'.

Closes-Bug: #1497060
Change-Id: I4857141c6e146bb6b9b9ffbbea169097bf4ffc20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/58/224958/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The password of user cirros is ``cubswin:)``

commit_message:
Update documentation for Vagrant environment

Implements: blueprint vagrant-improvements
Change-Id: I326e65333f368dc0081a36ffe93d325f2ccfab1b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/20/223420/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Vagrant is a tool to assist in scripted creation of virtual machines, it will take care of setting up CentOS-based VMs for Kolla development, each with proper hardware like memory amount and number of network interfaces.The Vagrant script proposes All-in-One or multi-node deployments, AIO being the default. In the case of multi-node deployment, the vagrant setup will build a cluster with the following nodes by default:- 1 storage node - 1 network nodeThese settings can be changed by editing the Vagrantfile. Kolla runs from the operator node to deploy OpenStack. On Fedora 22 it is as easy as:: sudo dnf install vagrant ruby-devel libvirt-devel After we will install the hostmanager plugin so all hosts are recorded in /etc/hosts (inside each vm)::we will use libvirt for now:: vagrant plugin install vagrant-libvirt We use NFS to share file between host and VMs:: sudo systemctl start nfs-server firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=2049/udp firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=2049/tcp firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=111/udp firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=111/tcp Find some place in your homedir and checkout the Kolla repo::You can now tweak the Vagrantfile or start a CentOS7-based environment right away::The command ``vagrant up`` will build your VMs , ``vagrant status`` will give you a quick overview once done.launching Kolla. First, connect with the *operator* node:: Building images ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ All you need to do once logged on the *operator* VM is calling the ``kolla-build`` utility:: kolla-build ``kolla-build`` accept arguments as documented in :doc:`image-building`. Deploying OpenStack with Kolla ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Deploy AIO with:: sudo kolla-ansible deploy Deploy multinode with:: sudo kolla-ansible deploy -i /usr/share/kolla/ansible/inventory/multinode You can then check that your OpenStack is alive:: source ~/openrc openstack user-list Or navigate to http://10.10.10.254/.
deleted_lines: Vagrant is a tool to assist in scripted creation of virtual machines, it will take care of setting up a CentOS-based cluster of virtual machines, each with proper hardware like memory amount and number of network interfaces.The vagrant setup will build a cluster with the following nodes:Kolla runs from the operator node to deploy OpenStack on the other nodes.After we will install the hostmanager plugin so all hosts are recorded in /etc/hosts (inside each vm): ::we will use VirtualBox for now. Find some place in your homedir and checkout the Kolla repo: ::You can now tweak the Vagrantfile or start a CentOS7-based cluster right away: ::The command ``vagrant up`` will build your cluster, ``vagrant status`` will give you a quick overview once done.launching Kolla. First, connect with the *operator* node: ::Once connected you can run a simple Ansible-style ping to verify if the cluster is operable: :: ansible -i kolla/ansible/inventory/multinode all -m ping -e ansible_ssh_user=root Congratulations, your cluster is usable and you can start deploying OpenStack using Ansible!

commit_message:
Update tuskar to support renamed heat roles

We are dropping the -puppet from the role templates in
the puppet directory. This change updates 90-tuskar-db-sync
so that it supports either case.

Change-Id: I71cb07b2f5305aaf9c43ab175cca976e844b8175

commit_message:
Expose serial, wwn and vendor on the BlockDevice object

Currently we only use these disk properties for root device hints.
However, they'll be really useful for inspector, especially for also
implementing root device hints.

Change-Id: I48aa6b6d2d198d16f2f8e387970f7230066cf8a2

commit_message:
Add 'image create' to openstack

Support for Image API v2 Image Creation.

Closes-Bug: 1405562
Change-Id: I485e0a30fc27d201e8982370614e3b6b4eb4309b
Co-Authored-By: Niall Bunting <niall.bunting@hp.com>

added_lines: import osimport openstackclient.common.exceptions as exceptions _disk_choices = ["None", "ami", "ari", "aki", "vhd", "vmdk", "raw", "qcow2", "vdi", "iso"] _container_choices = ["None", "ami", "ari", "aki", "bare", "ovf", "ova"] def gather_attributes(obj, desired_attrs): """Build an attribute dict from the object. Only include attributes requested in `desired_attrs`. """ attributes = {} for attr in desired_attrs: val = getattr(obj, attr, None) if val is not None: attributes[attr] = val return attributes class CreateImage(show.ShowOne): """Create/upload an image""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".CreateImage") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(CreateImage, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( "name", metavar="<name>", help="New image name" ) parser.add_argument( "--id", metavar="<id>", help="Image ID to reserve", ) parser.add_argument( "--tags", metavar="[<tags ...]", help="List of strings related to the image" ) parser.add_argument( "--protected", dest="protected", type=bool, default=False, help="Prevent image from being deleted" ) visibility_choices = ("public", "private") parser.add_argument( "--visibility", metavar="<visibility>", choices=visibility_choices, help="Scope of image accessibility. Valid values: {0}" .format(visibility_choices) ) parser.add_argument( "--property", dest="properties", metavar="<key=value>", action=parseractions.KeyValueAction, help=( "Set an image property " "(repeat option to set multiple properties)" ), ) parser.add_argument( "--min-disk", type=int, metavar="<disk-gb>", help="Minimum disk size needed to boot image, in gigabytes" ) parser.add_argument( "--disk-format", metavar="<disk-format>", choices=_disk_choices, help="Format of the disk. Valid values: %s" % _disk_choices ) parser.add_argument( "--min-ram", type=int, metavar="<ram-mb>", help="Amount of RAM (in MB) required to boot image" ) help_msg = ("Format of the container. Valid values: %s" % _container_choices) parser.add_argument( "--container-format", metavar="<container-format>", choices=_container_choices, help=help_msg ) parser.add_argument( "--file", metavar="<file>", help="Upload image from local file", ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): self.log.debug("take_action(%s)", parsed_args) image_client = self.app.client_manager.image if parsed_args.file: # allow any exception to bubble out _ = os.stat(parsed_args.file) kwargs = gather_attributes( parsed_args, ('container_format', 'disk_format', 'id', 'min_disk', 'min_ram', 'name', 'properties', 'protected', 'tags', 'visibility') ) image = image_client.images.create(**kwargs) fp = gc_utils.get_data_file(parsed_args) if not fp: log.warning("Failed to get an image file.") return {}, {} with fp: try: image_client.images.upload(image.id, fp) except Exception as e: # If the upload fails for some reason attempt to remove the # dangling queued image made by the create() call above # but only if the user did not specify an id which indicates # the Image already exists and should be left alone. try: if "id" not in kwargs: image_client.images.delete(image.id) except: pass # we don't care about this one raise e # now, throw it again # update the image after the data has been uploaded image = image_client.images.get(image.id) info = {} info.update(image) info['properties'] = utils.format_dict(info.get('properties', {})) return zip(*sorted(six.iteritems(info))) help_msg = ("Format of the disk. Valid values: %s" % _disk_choices) choices=_disk_choices, % _container_choices) choices=_container_choices, kwargs = gather_attributes( parsed_args, ('architecture', 'container_format', 'disk_format', 'file', 'kernel_id', 'min_disk', 'min_ram', 'name', 'os_distro', 'os_version', 'owner', 'protected', 'ramdisk_id', 'visibility') )

commit_message:
Remove pip install of pyscss in Horizon

Because of the correction of the dependney repos in RDO, pyscss
no longer needs to be installed via pip.

Change-Id: Ide0a0181a9b1353a043956ab9849a2d261f1c243
Closes-Bug: #1497436

subject: os-net-config: add ping_metadata_ip function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 21:24:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/3d7453d0d7d0e35c4de4a5c0e07326c8f5bf5af5', 'message': 'os-net-config: string replace METADATA_IP_ADDR

Updates the os-refresh-config script for os-net-config so that
it automatically obtains the "metadata IP address" from the
configured metadata_url. This IP address points back to
the undercloud server and is generally useful for setting
up some default routes (like a static route back to
169.254.169.254/32) in some network configurations.

Change-Id: I257e1cba6dee16f73f75512d1284e1e3b9d4c831
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-02 18:48:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/19e94447c00dfbfeb140c4b21ed5ec317e5d1e50', 'message': 'os-net-config: string replace METADATA_IP_ADDR

Updates the os-refresh-config script for os-net-config so that
it automatically obtains the "metadata IP address" from the
configured metadata_url. This IP address points back to
the undercloud server and is generally useful for setting
up some default routes (like a static route back to
169.254.169.254/32) in some network configurations.

Change-Id: I257e1cba6dee16f73f75512d1284e1e3b9d4c831
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-16 22:56:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/4fce62e91e9091f34845992c25b4ae9205817cdc', 'message': 'os-net-config: add ping_metadata_ip function

Updates os-net-config to use --detailed-exit-codes so that when
a network change has been detected we can perform a network validation
via the ping_metadata_ip function. This function performs a simple ping
test back to the IP address of the Heat API which should always be
available after any network configuration change.

The motivation for this change is to allow network configuration
changes time to settle. When making changes to the ctlplane (which
is typically used to contact the undercloud Heat API for subsequent
configuration notifications and updates) it is sometimes desirable to
wait a few seconds before proceeding. This avoids a race where the
ctlplane was switch to a static IP address and the very next
Heat notification would sometimes fail.

Change-Id: I257e1cba6dee16f73f75512d1284e1e3b9d4c831
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-16 23:00:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/34662dae85e7d084f21242ede1547ed358e3283c', 'message': 'os-net-config: add ping_metadata_ip function

Updates os-net-config to use --detailed-exit-codes so that when
a network change has been detected we can perform a network validation
via a new ping_metadata_ip function. This function performs a simple ping
test back to the IP address of the Heat API which should always be
available after any network configuration change.

The motivation for this change is to allow network configuration
changes time to settle. When making changes to the ctlplane (which
is typically used to contact the undercloud Heat API for subsequent
configuration notifications and updates) it is sometimes desirable to
wait a few seconds before proceeding. This avoids a race where the
ctlplane was switch to a static IP address and the very next
Heat notification would sometimes fail.

Depends-On: I8f22fa15335d1276f4e444a6454a24ff486e1495

test back to the IP address of the Heat API which should always be
available after any network configuration change.

The motivation for this change is to allow network configuration
changes time to settle. When making changes to the ctlplane (which
is typically used to contact the undercloud Heat API for subsequent
configuration notifications and updates) it is sometimes desirable to
wait a few seconds before proceeding. This avoids a race where the
ctlplane was switch to a static IP address and the very next
Heat notification would sometimes fail.

Depends-On: I8f22fa15335d1276f4e444a6454a24ff486e1495

Change-Id: I257e1cba6dee16f73f75512d1284e1e3b9d4c831
'}]
commit_message:
os-net-config: add ping_metadata_ip function

Updates os-net-config to use --detailed-exit-codes so that when
a network change has been detected we can perform a network validation
via a new ping_metadata_ip function. This function performs a simple ping
test back to the IP address of the Heat API which should always be
available after any network configuration change.

The motivation for this change is to allow network configuration
changes time to settle. When making changes to the ctlplane (which
is typically used to contact the undercloud Heat API for subsequent
configuration notifications and updates) it is sometimes desirable to
wait a few seconds before proceeding. This avoids a race where the
ctlplane was switch to a static IP address and the very next
Heat notification would sometimes fail.

Depends-On: I8f22fa15335d1276f4e444a6454a24ff486e1495

Change-Id: I257e1cba6dee16f73f75512d1284e1e3b9d4c831
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/39/197739/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE: We parse the metadata URL here to give us a handle to the # Undercloud IP for metadata traffic. This allows users # to optionally wire in 169.254.169.254 via their templates METADATA_IP_ADDR=$(os-apply-config --key os-collect-config.cfn.metadata_url --keey-default '' --type raw | sed -e 's|http://\([^:]*\).*|\1|') sed -i /etc/os-net-config/config.json -e "s|METADATA_IP_ADDR|$METADATA_IP_ADDR|g"

commit_message:
Change recon_lock_path to /var/lock

The Swift configuration item [filter:recon]/recon_lock_path is set to
'/var/lock/swift' by openstack-ansible in the appropriate configuration
files. The playbooks also create the directory if it does not exist. If
the host is rebooted the directory '/var/lock/swift' is missing and must
be recreated.

/var/lock (/run/lock) is a tmpfs and so the directory /var/lock/swift
will not persist between reboots.

Swift attempts to create a directory in the directory specified by
recon_lock_path however it does not recursively create any missing
parent directories.

This commit changes the value of [filter:recon]/recon_lock_path to that
set by Swift, '/var/lock'. This allows it to create the directory
'/var/lock/swift-recon-object-cron'. The creation of '/var/lock/swift'
is also removed from the playbooks.

Change-Id: I714367b02c7cf961e9e0bdee4e41f9e4e105b088
Closes-bug: #1496117
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/60/224060/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: recon_lock_path = /var/lock

commit_message:
Fix catch-all event def to exclude !event

Excluding an event using event definitions
gets overriden by the catch-all event def
and doesnt get excluded by default.

This fixes the catch-all (*) event def by
adding any excluded event types to it.

Change-Id: Iee42054d6159c579c80b14268ecaf76cb3929a3c
Closes-Bug: 1460808

commit_message:
Fix for multiple entries in ucast_mac_remote

checking mac and logical switch while creating l2-gateway-connection,
if there is entry in ucast_mac_remote for second l2-gateway-connection for
same logical switch.
taken care of deleting ucast_mac_remote and vlan_bindings
while deleting l2-gateway-connection.

Closes-Bug:1447910

Co-Authored-By: Phani Pawan <ppawan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: MANJUNATH PATIL <mpatil@hp.com>

Change-Id: Id9205c902210d94d7168eb95fbd6c3520fbb6239
(cherry picked from commit 5d4a4ad7904def80ef13ab0673103cf7be161716)

commit_message:
Fix for internal server error

internal server error occurs if empty l2gateway is passed in
_check_port_fault_status_and_switch_fault_status.so checking the the same.

Closes-Bug: 1454670

Change-Id: I5faba8d5e097b5ca8aeec44b7fde0a61d98486e4
(cherry picked from commit eaf54d893a5332ddd6ab9d747ed13ba5f28c05a3)

commit_message:
Remove unecessary constraint between Package and Config resource

Remove an unecessary contraint between the opencontrail neutron plugin
package and the neutron plugin config type as this constraint has been
moved directly within the type[1]

[1]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/2c21af85dac4353a6950e4cf153d9a0062dea294

Change-Id: I8d81dc48011c4cce869bbbeabf8e4c2d8ba8871e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 16:14:26.000000000', 'files': ['akanda/rug/test/unit/api/test_configuration.py', 'akanda/rug/api/configuration.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/astara/commit/760df4839ef2f97a6825f852b87556569c6c03c7', 'message': "Use a standard hostname to prevent setting invalid hostnames.

It's possible for a tenant to change their router's name to something that's
not a valid hostname.  This uses a standard ak-<tenant-uuid> value that we can

Change-Id: Id64f7c796f8ef01200f51494611458b5731149c8
Fixes-bug: #1496848

commit_message:
Use a standard hostname to prevent setting invalid hostnames.

It's possible for a tenant to change their router's name to something that's
not a valid hostname.  This uses a standard ak-<tenant-uuid> value that we can
rely on.

Change-Id: Id64f7c796f8ef01200f51494611458b5731149c8
Fixes-bug: #1496848
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/astara refs/changes/08/224808/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'hostname': 'ak-%s' % router.tenant_id

javascript. http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-empty

commit_message:
Message about available updates fixed

This change updates the verbage for repository connectivity and
maintence updates for the fuel master. It also includes a proper
documentation link.

Change-Id: I7da1bde77bfcdad66dc64c160b61964e93990dd3
Closes-Bug: #1495658
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@mirantis.com>

Remove entry_points

This change disables the entry_points lookup to
load commands.

A functional test to check CNAME recordsets allow only 1 record

Change-Id: Ifa7232d858a20db05cd03e949fbd3c4e891a6afb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/24/225324/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_cname_recordsets_cannot_have_more_than_one_record(self): post_model = datagen.random_cname_recordset(zone_name=self.zone.name) post_model.records = [ "a.{0}".format(self.zone.name), "b.{0}".format(self.zone.name), ] client = RecordsetClient.as_user('default'). self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest, client.post_recordset(self.zone_id, post_model), fixture = self.useFixture(RecordsetFixture(self.zone.id, post_model)) self.assertEquals(fixture.post_resp.status, 400)

commit_message:
Ensure CNAME RRSets only have one record

Throw a 400 error back at the user if they try to create a CNAME
RRSet with more than 1 record.

Change-Id: I252fcd046dc902ff28162d831c0c0fd6b0dea3d2
Closes-Bug: 1486743
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/06/224906/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _is_valid_recordset_records(self, recordset): """ Check to make sure that the records in the recordset follow the rules, and won't blow up on the nameserver. """ if hasattr(recordset, 'records'): if len(recordset.records) > 1 and recordset.type == 'CNAME': raise exceptions.BadRequest( 'CNAME recordsets may not have more than 1 record' ) self._is_valid_recordset_records(recordset) self._is_valid_recordset_records(recordset)

Message about available updates fixed

This change updates the verbage for repository connectivity and
maintence updates for the fuel master. It also includes a proper
documentation link.

commit_message:
Create Heat Domain with Keystone_domain resource

 This patch replaces the usage of Exec to create the Heat domain, by
 using the Keystone_domain resource recently implemented in
 puppet-keystone.

cherry picked from Upstream commit: 3ced80f)

Change-Id: I8cd5af772867dfe00a131b119e12800a8e2ec021
Closes-Bug: #1484066
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/63/224463/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Configures Heat domain in Keystone.# [*domain_name*] # Heat domain name. Defaults to 'heat'. # # [*domain_admin*] # Keystone domain admin user which will be created. Defaults to 'heat_admin'. # # [*domain_admin_email*] # Keystone domain admin user email address. Defaults to 'heat_admin@localhost'. # [*domain_password*] # Keystone domain admin user password. Defaults to 'changeme'. # # === Deprecated Parameters # $domain_name = 'heat', $domain_admin = 'heat_admin', $domain_admin_email = 'heat_admin@localhost', $domain_password = 'changeme', # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $auth_url = undef, $keystone_admin = undef, $keystone_password = undef, $keystone_tenant = undef, if $auth_url { warning('The auth_url parameter is deprecated and will be removed in future releases') } if $keystone_admin { warning('The keystone_admin parameter is deprecated and will be removed in future releases') } if $keystone_password { warning('The keystone_password parameter is deprecated and will be removed in future releases') } if $keystone_tenant { warning('The keystone_tenant parameter is deprecated and will be removed in future releases') } ensure_resource('keystone_domain', 'heat_domain', { 'ensure' => 'present', 'enabled' => true, 'name' => $domain_name }) ensure_resource('keystone_user', 'heat_domain_admin', { 'ensure' => 'present', 'enabled' => true, 'name' => $domain_admin, 'email' => $domain_admin_email, 'password' => $domain_password, 'domain' => $domain_name, }) ensure_resource('keystone_user_role', "${domain_admin}@::${domain_name}", { 'roles' => ['admin'], })
deleted_lines: # Configures heat domain in Keystone. # # Note: Implementation is done by heat-keystone-setup-domain script temporarily # because currently puppet-keystone does not support v3 API# [*domain_name*] # Heat domain name. Defaults to 'heat'. # # [*domain_admin*] # Keystone domain admin user which will be created. Defaults to 'heat_admin'. # # [*domain_password*] # Keystone domain admin user password. Defaults to 'changeme'. # $auth_url = undef, $keystone_admin = undef, $keystone_password = undef, $keystone_tenant = undef, $domain_name = 'heat', $domain_admin = 'heat_admin', $domain_password = 'changeme', $cmd_evn = [ "OS_TENANT_NAME=${keystone_tenant}", "OS_USERNAME=${keystone_admin}", "OS_PASSWORD=${keystone_password}", "OS_AUTH_URL=${auth_url}", "HEAT_DOMAIN=${domain_name}", "HEAT_DOMAIN_ADMIN=${domain_admin}", "HEAT_DOMAIN_PASSWORD=${domain_password}" ] exec { 'heat_domain_create': path => '/usr/bin', command => 'heat-keystone-setup-domain', environment => $cmd_evn, require => Package['heat-common'], logoutput => 'on_failure', # TODO (iberezovskiy): propose upstream patch for retries tries => 10, try_sleep => 3 }

commit_message:
adds the config_template to tempest

The change modifies the tempest template tasks such that it's now
using the config_template action plugin. This change will make so that
config files can be dynamically updated, by a deployer, at run time,
without requiring the need to modify the in tree templates or defaults.

Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

Change-Id: I3b664fcec14bf01f9916ced0b8595a57d4873f79

commit_message:
Remove unused Node dependencies.

This removes several large and unnecessary node dependencies,
reducing the total space consumed by build dependencies by around
34%. In particular, `gulp-imagemin` and `debowerify` (along with
their associated build steps) are removed, freeing ~200MB.

Change-Id: Ic560d30c559ddd24f1a7089f5287ce26108de212

subject: Disable the _cleanup_incomplete_migrations() periodic task by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-21 14:52:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3a770abb7350df43dbd0727b78cfd1a54b75116c', 'message': "Disable the _cleanup_incomplete_migrations() periodic task by default

This patch disables the incomplete migration cleanup periodic task by
default because it will destroy data if an instance is on shared storage.
If an instance was involved in a failed migration, the task deletes the
instance storage without checking whether it is on shared storage first.
This means that it could delete the one and only copy of an instance's
data because one side of a failed migration ran this task.

Unfortunately, the original code was using an existing configuration
variable for control, to make it backportable. Thus, this patch must add
another variable to split control of the two tasks, so that the offending
one may be disabled by default.

Deployers that do not use shared storage that are concerned about the
security implications of the original bug (1392527) should re-enable
this task on their systems at a reasonable interval. Deployers that are
using shared storage SHOULD NOT ENABLE THIS, but also should  not be
affected by the aforementioned bug either.

This is considered the least amount of change we can make to mitigate
the issue at this point in the release.

DocImpact: This needs explanation for the deployers to make a proper
decision during initial configuration. It also deserves release note
material for people upgrading to this code.

Change-Id: I9f8c26cfb545a56bc5736064ec672e4d76e057d7
Partial-Bug: #1498023

commit_message:
Disable the _cleanup_incomplete_migrations() periodic task by default

This patch disables the incomplete migration cleanup periodic task by
default because it will destroy data if an instance is on shared storage.
If an instance was involved in a failed migration, the task deletes the
instance storage without checking whether it is on shared storage first.
This means that it could delete the one and only copy of an instance's
data because one side of a failed migration ran this task.

Unfortunately, the original code was using an existing configuration
variable for control, to make it backportable. Thus, this patch must add
another variable to split control of the two tasks, so that the offending
one may be disabled by default.

Deployers that do not use shared storage that are concerned about the
security implications of the original bug (1392527) should re-enable
this task on their systems at a reasonable interval. Deployers that are
using shared storage SHOULD NOT ENABLE THIS, but also should  not be
affected by the aforementioned bug either.

This is considered the least amount of change we can make to mitigate
the issue at this point in the release.

DocImpact: This needs explanation for the deployers to make a proper
decision during initial configuration. It also deserves release note
material for people upgrading to this code.

Change-Id: I9f8c26cfb545a56bc5736064ec672e4d76e057d7
Partial-Bug: #1498023

' 'Setting this to 0 will run at the default rate. ' 'NB: DO NOT ENABLE THIS IF YOU ARE ON SHARED STORAGE. ' 'See launchpad bug #1498023 for details.'), @periodic_task.periodic_task(spacing=CONF.migration_cleanup_interval) # FIXME(danms): We need to check if the instance is # on shared storage and NOT delete the files if so!

commit_message:
Remove POSIX file modes.

This patch removes File resources, which should be delivered by packaging
tools. These resources (files and directories with attributes) could be in
conflict with different OS packaging systems, which isn't a desired result.

Change-Id: Ife7d6b061380ea5ddcdf581c22e0fa6b1d31da61
Closes-bug: #1458915

commit_message:
Refactor agent {prepare,tear_down}_cleaning into deploy_utils

This commit refactors code from AgentDeploy.prepare_cleaning and
AgentDeploy.tear_down_cleaning into a common place so that it
can be reused for ISCSIDeploy. It also moves the method
agent.build_agent_options to deploy_utils module.

The following CONF options have been deprecated and renamed:
[agent]agent_erase_devices_priority => [deploy]erase_devices_priority
[agent]agent_erase_devices_iterations => [deploy]erase_devices_iterations

The old CONF options will be removed in the Mitaka release.

Change-Id: I818c9f81f5469bf5029495dc9b65259718c41cd5
Implements: blueprint iscsi-deploy-in-band-cleaning

commit_message:
Rely on autorequire for config resource ordering

Currently we specify the ordering of config resources wherever it is
necessary based on the presence of the file it will write to, or the
presence of the package in charge of providing the file it will write
to.

Those kind of ordering can be specified directly at the resource level
using the autorequire mechanism. With this patch, any config resource
will make sure the package in charge of providing the file will be
installed first.

Change-Id: I73285227e9bbd0c895d9f74bab9e9bb65acaba40

commit_message:
Revert "Fix Sahara installation for Ubuntu"

This commit reverts "Fix Sahara installation for Ubuntu" (I4c9e9206e3e60f3c85224ae120516badb331672e)
because bug 1450945 is duplicate for 1452698 and it was fixed for Liberty.

Change-Id: I8e013f52e3dae80764f9d71783f8ebbddc0aa1ae
Related-bug: #1450945
Related-bug: #1452698

added_lines: mode => '0750', require => Package['sahara'], mode => '0640', Package['sahara-common'] -> Sahara_config<||>
deleted_lines: group { 'sahara': ensure => 'present', name => 'sahara', } require => Group['sahara'], # Because Sahara does not support SQLite, sahara-common will fail to be installed # if /etc/sahara/sahara.conf does not contain valid database connection and if the # database does not actually exist. # So we first manage the configuration file existence, then we configure Sahara and # then we install Sahara. This is a very ugly hack to fix packaging issue. # https://bugs.launchpad.net/cloud-archive/+bug/1450945 File['/etc/sahara/sahara.conf'] -> Sahara_config<| |> Sahara_config<| |> -> Package['sahara-common']

commit_message:
Enable bandit check for password_config_option_not_marked_secret

The password_config_option_not_marked_secret was not enabled and it
didn't pass because it considered the [auth] password config option
to be a password option that wasn't set to secret when it's actually
just the plugin for the password.

Enable the check and mark the [auth] password config option as not
a security issue. This will help us catch new password config
options that aren't marked as secret, which has been a common
issue.

Change-Id: I34cce901a8aff3e8c4e43debf400904b5b236867
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/20/194420/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - password_config_option_not_marked_secret password_config_option_not_marked_secret: function_names: - oslo.config.cfg.StrOpt - oslo_config.cfg.StrOpt

commit_message:
Add auth version for legacy OpenStack clients

Adding this environment variable expands Identity v3 coverage for legacy
OpenStack CLI clients. This corrects the authentication URLs used even
if v2 is still being used.

Change-Id: I68197ffd12d71a437c482f13520b83cb08d4c9de
Closes-Bug: #1495685

commit_message:
Adds the config_template to keystone

The change modifies the keystone template tasks such that it's now
using the config_template action plugin. This change will make so that
config files can be dynamically updated, by a deployer, at run time,
without requiring the need to modify the in tree templates or defaults.

Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

Change-Id: I957d55df81c7edd4e2a95597a62a75c6bd0f46fe

commit_message:
Adds the config_template to glance

The change modifies the glance template tasks such that it's now
using the config_template action plugin. This change will make so that
config files can be dynamically updated, by a deployer, at run time,
without requiring the need to modify the in tree templates or defaults.

Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

Change-Id: I13fc6f38679267a84104cae948517d185e9f4ece

commit_message:
adds the config_template to pip_lock_down

The change modifies the pip_lock_down template tasks such that it's now
using the config_template action plugin. This change will make so that
config files can be dynamically updated, by a deployer, at run time,
without requiring the need to modify the in tree templates or defaults.

Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

Change-Id: I620b7f599a9e41f5fe38a2d038b53cfa227c1d55

commit_message:
adds the config_template to galera_server

The change modifies the galera_server template tasks such that it's now
using the config_template action plugin. This change will make so that
config files can be dynamically updated, by a deployer, at run time,
without requiring the need to modify the in tree templates or defaults.

Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

Change-Id: I6f34dff6e3a8ab8d2aad6a413b9a59f325c1be7b

commit_message:
Add filter to secret list for acl secrets

Adds a ACL only filter when getting the list of secrets. If
'http://barbican:9311/v1/secrets/acl_only=true' is given then
the list of secrets returned should only contain secrets that the
user is on the ACL for (regardless of project).
If acl_only is false or is not given, then
the default project based behaviour will be used.

DocImpact
APIImpact
Change-Id: I8e511d29b77ce15d2000ee2876a12cf6a95771c6
Closes-Bug: #1459780

added_lines: def test_list_secrets_with_no_acls_and_acl_only_should_be_empty(self): """Return list should be empty""" creator_user_id = 'creatorUserID' self._create_secret_with_creator_user( self.app, creator_user_id) resp = self.app.get( '/secrets/?acl_only=true') self.assertEqual(200, resp.status_int) self.assertEqual([], resp.json['secrets']) def test_list_secrets_with_acls(self): """Return List should not include secrets with no ACL for user""" creator_user_id = 'creatorUserID' secret_uuid_acl_1 = self._create_secret_with_creator_user( self.app, creator_user_id) secret_uuid_acl_2 = self._create_secret_with_creator_user( self.app, creator_user_id) secret_uuid_no_acl = self._create_secret_with_creator_user( self.app, creator_user_id) create_acls( self.app, 'secrets', secret_uuid_acl_1, read_user_ids=[creator_user_id], read_project_access=False) create_acls( self.app, 'secrets', secret_uuid_acl_2, read_user_ids=[creator_user_id], read_project_access=False) resp = self.app.get( '/secrets/?acl_only=true') self.assertEqual(200, resp.status_int) secret_list = resp.json.get('secrets') self.assertEquals(len(secret_list), 2) self.assertNotIn(secret_uuid_no_acl, secret_list)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-21 13:43:04.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_rpc_acknowledge.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/errors/__init__.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_task.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/52ed7e621cffe8b448b28d3d98a5ec722b75a3e1', 'message': 'ErrorsFactory returns only defined errors

ErrorsFactory had __getattr__ method that was used to always
return any error (if it doesn't existed, it created a new one).
This was causing "hasattr" to return 'True' for every check.
Due to this any code, that wanted to check for some unique attributes
in ErrorsFactory was working incorrectly. This was the case for

commit_message:
ErrorsFactory returns only defined errors

ErrorsFactory had __getattr__ method that was used to always
return any error (if it doesn't existed, it created a new one).
This was causing "hasattr" to return 'True' for every check.
Due to this any code, that wanted to check for some unique attributes
in ErrorsFactory was working incorrectly. This was the case for
a py.test library when scannig code when looking for tests.
Now this behavior has been removed. This uncovered new bugs
which was fixed.

Change-Id: I3c9be96dbcc535ea9c730d29b065479cc318fd9f
Closes-Bug: #1497664
(cherry picked from commit 9757292c3b7f2a8d955fbe2cc1673a2baac702e5)
